00505 private:
00506     void split(std::vector<std::string> &tokens, const std::string& text, char sep)
00507     {
00508         int start = 0, end = 0;
00509         while ((end = text.find(sep, start)) != std::string::npos) {
00510             tokens.push_back(text.substr(start, end - start));
00511             start = end + 1;
00512         }
00513         tokens.push_back(text.substr(start));
00514     }

00563 inline
00564 test_root::test_root() 
00565     : m_verbose(false) 
00566     , m_stop_on_failure(false)
00567     , m_reverse_mode(false)
00568     , m_error_count(0)
00569     , m_current_test_info(0)
00570     , m_exception_happened(false)
00571     , m_assertion_tested(false)
00572 {
00573 }
00574 
00575 inline
00576 test_root::~test_root()
00577 {
00578     if (std::uncaught_exception())
00579     {
00580         increase_error_count();
00581     }
00582         
00583     if (error_count() > 0)
00584     {
00585         std::cout << "\nTest driver failed: " 
00586             << error_count() << (error_count() == 1 ? " error" : " errors") 
00587             << std::endl;
00588     }
00589     else if (m_exception_happened)
00590     {
00591         std::cout << "\nTest driver failed: "
00592        "Failure due to exception(s) for which there are no tests/assertions."
00593                   << std::endl;
00594 
00595     }
00596     else if (verbose())
00597     {
00598         if (assertion_tested())
00599         {
00600             std::cout << "\nTest driver succeeded." << std::endl;
00601         }
00602         else
00603         {
00604             std::cout << "\nTest driver succeeded but no assertions were actually made." << std::endl;
00605         }
00606     }
00607 }
00608

00657 inline
00658 int test_root::return_status() const
00659 {
00660     return (m_error_count == 0 && 
00661             !m_exception_happened) ? EXIT_SUCCESS : EXIT_FAILURE;    
00662 }

00692 inline
00693 void test_root::increase_error_count()
00694 {
00695     ++m_error_count;
00696 }
00697 
00698 inline
00699 void test_root::set_exception_happened()
00700 {
00701     m_exception_happened = true;
00702 }
00703 
00704 inline
00705 void test_root::decrease_error_count()
00706 {
00707     if (m_error_count > 0)
00708     {
00709          --m_error_count;
00710     }
00711 }
00712 
00713 inline
00714 void test_root::test_assert(
00715     bool condition, const std::string& test_case_name, 
00716     const char *msg, const char* filename, int line_number)
00717 {
00718     set_assertion_tested();
00719 
00720     if (condition == reverse_mode())
00721     {
00722         std::cout
00723             << "Error: " << test_case_name << " in " 
00724             << filename << "(" << line_number << "): " 
00725             << msg << " failed." << std::endl;
00726                 
00727         increase_error_count();
00728         
00729         if (stop_on_failure())
00730         {
00731             // decrement error count to compensate for later increase
00732             // caused by uncaught exception bumping the count in
00733             // test_root::exception_handler.
00734 
00735             decrease_error_count();
00736             throw std::runtime_error("test assertion failed");
00737         }
00738     }
00739 }
00740 
00741 inline
00742 test_root::suite 
00743 test_root::do_get_suite(const test_root::suite& available_tests, 
00744                       int argc, char* argv[])
00745 {
00746     std::stringstream str;
00747     str << "USAGE: \n\n"
00748         << "    " << argv[0] << " [-h] [-r] [-a] [-v] [--] <testNameString> ...\n\n"
00749         << "Where: \n\n"
00750         << "   -h,  --help           produces this help\n\n"
00751         << "   -r,  --reverse        reverses the sense of test assertions.\n\n"
00752         << "   -a,  --assert_fatal   is used to make the first test failure fatal.\n\n"
00753         << "   -v,  --verbose        turns on extra trace for those tests that have made use of it.\n\n"
00754         << "   --,  --ignore_rest    Ignores the rest of the labeled arguments following this flag.\n\n\n"
00755         << "   <testNameString>  (accepted multiple times)\n"
00756         << "     test names\n\n"
00757         << "   Any number of test names may be supplied on the command line. If the\n"
00758         << "   name 'all' is included then all tests will be run.\n\n";
00759 
00760     std::string usage_text = str.str();
00761     m_verbose = false;
00762     m_stop_on_failure = false;
00763     m_reverse_mode = false;
00764     bool help = false;
00765     suite result;
00766     bool found_tests = false;
00767     bool parsed_ok = true;
00768     test_info current_test_info;
00769     bool include_all = false;
00770 
00771     for (size_t i = 1; i < argc; i++)
00772     {
00773         if (found_tests)
00774         {
00775             if (argv[i][0] == '-')
00776             {
00777                 if (strcmp(argv[i], "-a") == 0 || strcmp(argv[i], "--args") == 0)
00778                 {
00779                     if ((i+1) < argc)
00780                     {
00781                         std::vector<test_info>::iterator it = result.begin();
00782                         for (; it != result.end(); ++it)
00783                         {
00784                             if (it->m_test_name == current_test_info.m_test_name)
00785                             { 
00786                                 test_info& info_ref = *it;
00787                                 split(info_ref.m_arguments, argv[i+1], ' ');
00788                                 i++;
00789                                 break;
00790                             }
00791                         }
00792                     }
00793                 }
00794                 else
00795                 {
00796                     parsed_ok = false;
00797                 }
00798             }
00799             else
00800             {
00801                 current_test_info = test_info();
00802                 current_test_info.m_test_name = argv[i];
00803                 result.push_back(current_test_info);
00804                 if (current_test_info.m_test_name == "all")
00805                     include_all = true;
00806             }
00807         }
00808         else
00809         {
00810             if (argv[i][0] == '-')
00811             {
00812                 if (strcmp(argv[i], "-v") == 0 || strcmp(argv[i], "--verbose") == 0)
00813                 {
00814                     m_verbose = true;
00815                 }
00816                 else if (strcmp(argv[i], "-a") == 0 || strcmp(argv[i], "--assert_fatal") == 0)
00817                 {
00818                     m_stop_on_failure = true;
00819                 }
00820                 else if (strcmp(argv[i], "-r") == 0 || strcmp(argv[i], "--reverse") == 0)
00821                 {
00822                     m_reverse_mode = true;
00823                 }
00824                 else if (strcmp(argv[i], "-h") == 0 || strcmp(argv[i], "--help") == 0)
00825                 {
00826                     help = true;
00827                 }
00828                 else
00829                 {
00830                     std::cout << "Error: option '" << argv[i] << "' is unrecognised. Use --help if you are stuck." << std::endl;
00831                     parsed_ok = false;
00832                     break;
00833                 }
00834             }
00835             else
00836             {
00837                 found_tests = true;
00838                 current_test_info = test_info();
00839                 current_test_info.m_test_name = argv[i];
00840                 result.push_back(current_test_info);
00841                 if (current_test_info.m_test_name == "all")
00842                     include_all = true;
00843             }
00844         }
00845     }
00846 
00847     if (!parsed_ok)
00848     {
00849         throw std::runtime_error("There is something wrong with the command line.");
00850     }
00851 
00852     if (result.size() == 0 || include_all)
00853     {
00854         result = available_tests;
00855     }
00856 
00857     if (help)
00858     {
00859         std::cout << usage_text << std::endl;
00860         std::cout << "Supported test names are:" << std::endl;
00861         for (suite::const_iterator it = available_tests.begin(); 
00862              it != available_tests.end(); ++it)
00863         {
00864             std::cout << "    " << it->m_test_name << std::endl;
00865         }
00866         exit(EXIT_SUCCESS);
00867     }
00868 
00869     return result;
00870 }
00871 
00872 inline
00873 int test_root::exception_handler()
00874 {
00875     try
00876     {
00877         throw;
00878     }
00879     catch (std::exception& e)
00880     {
00881         std::cout << "Error: " << e.what() << std::endl;        
00882         m_exception_happened = true;
00883     }
00884     catch (...)
00885     {
00886         std::cout << "Error: " << "unknown exception" << std::endl;
00887         m_exception_happened = true;
00888     }    
00889     return EXIT_FAILURE;
00890 }
00891 
00892 inline
00893 std::string test_root::underline(const std::string& title, char c)
00894 {
00895     std::string result;
00896     for (size_t i = 0; i != title.size(); ++i)
00897         result += c;        
00898     return result;
00899 }
00900 
00901 // The fructose double comparison routines are the same apart from
00902 // the name of the double_compare function actually called and
00903 // the string ("==", "!=" etc) in the diagnostic message.
00904 // Hence we generate the inline function definition using the
00905 // macros below. Note that we have two macros; one for the comparison
00906 // with specific tolerances stated, the other without.
00907 
00908 #define generate_fructose_assert_double_compare(comparison_function, \
00909                                                 comparison_name) \
00910 inline \
00911 void test_root::test_assert_double_##comparison_function(double lhs, \
00912                                    double rhs, \
00913                                    const std::string& test_case_name, \
00914                                    const char* lhs_name, \
00915                                    const char* rhs_name,\
00916                                    const char* filename, int line_number) \
00917 { \
00918     set_assertion_tested();                                          \
00919     bool is_compared = double_compare::comparison_function(lhs, rhs);\
00920     if (is_compared == reverse_mode()) \
00921     { \
00922         char number1[22]; \
00923         char number2[22]; \
00924         snprintf(number1, sizeof(number1), "%21.15e", lhs); \
00925         snprintf(number2, sizeof(number2), "%21.15e", rhs); \
00926         std::cout \
00927             << "Error: " << get_test_name() << " in "    \
00928             << filename << "(" << line_number << "): " \
00929             << lhs_name << " " comparison_name " " << rhs_name \
00930             << " (" << number1 << " " comparison_name " " << number2 << ")" \
00931             << " failed floating point compare." << std::endl; \
00932         increase_error_count(); \
00933         if (stop_on_failure()) \
00934         { \
00935             decrease_error_count(); \
00936             throw std::runtime_error("test assertion failed"); \
00937         } \
00938     } \
00939 }
00940 
00941 #define generate_fructose_assert_double_compare_tol(comparison_function, \
00942                                                 comparison_name) \
00943 inline \
00944 void test_root::test_assert_double_##comparison_function(double lhs, \
00945                                    double rhs, \
00946                                    double relative_tolerance, \
00947                                    double absolute_tolerance, \
00948                                    const std::string& test_case_name, \
00949                                    const char* lhs_name, \
00950                                    const char* rhs_name,\
00951                                    const char* filename, int line_number) \
00952 { \
00953     set_assertion_tested();                                     \
00954     bool is_compared = double_compare::comparison_function(lhs, rhs, \
00955                             relative_tolerance, absolute_tolerance); \
00956     if (is_compared == reverse_mode()) \
00957     { \
00958         char number1[22]; \
00959         char number2[22]; \
00960         snprintf(number1, sizeof(number1), "%21.15e", lhs); \
00961         snprintf(number2, sizeof(number2), "%21.15e", rhs); \
00962         std::cout \
00963             << "Error: " << test_case_name << " in "  \
00964             << filename << "(" << line_number << "): " \
00965             << lhs_name << " " comparison_name " " << rhs_name \
00966             << " (" << number1 << " " comparison_name " " << number2 << ")" \
00967             << " failed floating point compare." << std::endl; \
00968         increase_error_count(); \
00969         if (stop_on_failure()) \
00970         { \
00971             decrease_error_count(); \
00972             throw std::runtime_error("test assertion failed"); \
00973         } \
00974     } \
00975 }
00976 
00977 // Generate the code for all the inline comparison function definitions.
00978 
00979 generate_fructose_assert_double_compare(eq, "==")
00980 generate_fructose_assert_double_compare(ne, "!=")
00981 generate_fructose_assert_double_compare(lt, "<")
00982 generate_fructose_assert_double_compare(le, "<=")
00983 generate_fructose_assert_double_compare(gt, ">")
00984 generate_fructose_assert_double_compare(ge, ">=")
00985 
00986 // same again but this time with the tolerances specified.
00987 
00988 generate_fructose_assert_double_compare_tol(eq, "==")
00989 generate_fructose_assert_double_compare_tol(ne, "!=")
00990 generate_fructose_assert_double_compare_tol(lt, "<")
00991 generate_fructose_assert_double_compare_tol(le, "<=")
00992 generate_fructose_assert_double_compare_tol(gt, ">")
00993 generate_fructose_assert_double_compare_tol(ge, ">=")
00994 
00995 template <typename lhs_type, typename rhs_type>
00996 inline
00997 void test_root::test_assert_eq(const lhs_type& lhs, const rhs_type& rhs,
00998                                    const std::string& test_case_name, 
00999                                    const char *msg1, const char* msg2,
01000                                    const char* filename, int line_number)
01001 {
01002     set_assertion_tested();
01003 
01004     if ((lhs == rhs) == reverse_mode())
01005     {
01006         std::cout
01007             << "Error: " << test_case_name << " in " 
01008             << filename << "(" << line_number << "): " 
01009             << msg1 << " == " << msg2
01010             << " (" << lhs << " == " << rhs << ")"
01011             << " failed." << std::endl;
01012                 
01013         increase_error_count();
01014         if (stop_on_failure())
01015         {
01016             // decrement error count to compensate for later increase
01017             // caused by uncaught exception bumping the count in
01018             // test_root::exception_handler.
01019 
01020             decrease_error_count();
01021             throw std::runtime_error("test assertion failed");
01022         }
01023     }
01024 }
01025 
01026 template <typename lhs_type, typename rhs_type>
01027 inline
01028 void test_root::test_assert_ne(const lhs_type& lhs, const rhs_type& rhs,
01029                                    const std::string& test_case_name, 
01030                                    const char *msg1, const char* msg2,
01031                                    const char* filename, int line_number)
01032 {
01033     set_assertion_tested();
01034 
01035     if ((lhs != rhs) == reverse_mode())
01036     {
01037         std::cout
01038             << "Error: " << test_case_name << " in " 
01039             << filename << "(" << line_number << "): " 
01040             << msg1 << " != " << msg2
01041             << " (" << lhs << " != " << rhs << ")"
01042             << " failed." << std::endl;
01043                 
01044         increase_error_count();
01045         if (stop_on_failure())
01046         {
01047             // decrement error count to compensate for later increase
01048             // caused by uncaught exception bumping the count in
01049             // test_root::exception_handler.
01050 
01051             decrease_error_count();
01052             throw std::runtime_error("test assertion failed");
01053         }
01054     }
01055 }
01056 
01057 inline
01058 void test_root::test_assert_same_data(const void* lhs, const void* rhs,
01059                                       unsigned int data_length,
01060                                       const std::string& test_case_name, 
01061                                       const char *msg1, const char* msg2,
01062                                       const char* filename, int line_number)
01063 {
01064     set_assertion_tested();
01065     unsigned int data_index(-1);
01066     bool test_result = same_as(lhs, rhs, data_length, data_index);
01067     if (test_result == reverse_mode())
01068     {
01069         std::stringstream str1;
01070         std::stringstream str2;
01071         str1 << lhs;
01072         str2 << rhs;
01073         std::string address1 = str1.str();
01074         std::string address2 = str2.str();
01075         std::cout
01076             << "Error: " << test_case_name << " in " 
01077             << filename << "(" << line_number << "): " 
01078             << "The data at " << address1 << " and " << address2 << " (" << data_length << " bytes) is different. "
01079             << "First difference is at offset " << data_index
01080             << ". Assertion failed." << std::endl;
01081                 
01082         increase_error_count();
01083         if (stop_on_failure())
01084         {
01085             // decrement error count to compensate for later increase
01086             // caused by uncaught exception bumping the count in
01087             // test_root::exception_handler.
01088 
01089             decrease_error_count();
01090             throw std::runtime_error("test assertion failed");
01091         }
01092     }
01093 }
01094 
01095 inline
01096 bool test_root::same_as (const void* lhs, const void* rhs, unsigned int data_length, unsigned int& the_data_index)
01097 {
01098     bool retval = true;
01099     unsigned int data_index = -1;
01100     if (data_length == 0 || lhs == rhs)
01101     {
01102         retval = true;
01103     }
01104     else if (lhs == 0 || rhs == 0)
01105     {
01106         retval = false;
01107     }
01108     else
01109     {
01110         const unsigned char* clhs = (const unsigned char*)lhs;
01111         const unsigned char* crhs = (const unsigned char*)rhs;
01112         retval = true;
01113         while (data_length-- > 0)
01114         {
01115             ++data_index;
01116             if (*clhs++ != *crhs++)
01117             {
01118                 retval = false;
01119                 break;
01120             }
01121         }
01122     }
01123 
01124     if (!retval)
01125     {
01126         the_data_index = data_index;
01127     }
01128 
01129     return retval;
01130 }
01131

01160 #ifdef FRUCTOSE_USING_HAMCREST
01161 #define fructose_assert_that(actual, matcher)                                 \
01162     do                                                                        \
01163     {                                                                         \
01164         set_assertion_tested();                                               \
01165         if (matcher(actual) == reverse_mode())                                \
01166         {                                                                     \
01167             hamcrest::description_t description;                          \
01168             description.append_text("Expected: ")                             \
01169                        .append_description_of(matcher)                        \
01170                        .append_text(", got: ")                                \
01171                        .append_value(actual);                                 \
01172             std::cout                                                         \
01173                  << "Error: " << get_test_name() << " in "                    \
01174                  << __FILE__ << "(" << __LINE__ << "): "                      \
01175                  << description.description_m << std::endl;                   \
01176             increase_error_count();                                           \
01177             if (stop_on_failure())                                            \
01178             {                                                                 \
01179                 decrease_error_count();                                       \
01180                 throw std::runtime_error("test assertion failed");            \
01181             }                                                                 \
01182         }                                                                     \
01183     } while (false)
01184 
01185 #define FRUTOSE_ASSERT_THAT(actual, matcher) fructose_assert_that(actual, matcher)
01186 #endif

01301     if ((X) == reverse_mode()) \
01302     { std::cout << #I << ": " << I << "\n"; \
01303                        fructose::test_root::test_assert(reverse_mode(), \
01304                        get_test_name(),  #X, __FILE__, __LINE__); }}

01364 #define fructose_assert_exception(X, E) \
01365     {                                \
01366         set_assertion_tested();      \
01367         std::string report;          \
01368         bool ok = false;             \
01369         bool caught = false;         \
01370         try                          \
01371         {                            \
01372             try                      \
01373             {                        \
01374                 X;                   \
01375             }                        \
01376             catch(E&)                \
01377             {                        \
01378                 ok = true;           \
01379                 caught = true;       \
01380             }                        \
01381         }                            \
01382         catch(std::exception & e)    \
01383         {                            \
01384             std::ostringstream ostr; \
01385             ostr << e.what();        \
01386             report = "exception caught as std::exception: "; \
01387             report += ostr.str();    \
01388             caught = true;           \
01389         }                            \
01390         catch(...)                   \
01391         {                            \
01392             caught = true;           \
01393             report = "caught in catchall"; \
01394         }                            \
01395         if (!ok)                     \
01396         {                            \
01397             if (caught)              \
01398             {                        \
01399    std::cout << "exception caught but not of expected type" << std::endl; \
01400    if (report.length() > 0)          \
01401    { \
01402        std::cout <<  report << std::endl; \
01403    } \
01404             }                \
01405             else             \
01406             {                \
01407    std::cout << "expected an exception to be thrown but catchall caught nothing" << std::endl; \
01408             }                \
01409         }                    \
01410         fructose::test_root::test_assert(ok, get_test_name(),  #X " throws " #E, __FILE__, __LINE__);} 
01411 
01412 #define FRUCTOSE_ASSERT_EXCEPTION(X, E) fructose_assert_exception(X, E)
01413 
01414 #define fructose_assert_no_exception(X) {      \
01415         set_assertion_tested();          \
01416         bool no_exception_thrown = true; \
01417         try {X;}                         \
01418         catch(std::exception& e)         \
01419         {                                \
01420             no_exception_thrown = false; \
01421 std::cout << "Error: An exception was thrown where none expected. " \
01422 << "Exception is: " << e.what() << std::endl; \
01423             fructose_assert(no_exception_thrown)  \
01424         }                                \
01425         catch(...)                       \
01426         {                                \
01427             no_exception_thrown = false; \
01428             fructose_assert(no_exception_thrown)  \
01429         }}
01430 
01431 #define FRUCTOSE_ASSERT_NO_EXCEPTION(X) fructose_assert_no_exception(X)
01432 
01433 #endif
